isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Lubrication, Inspection and Maintenance - Oil Level

step1.para: Verify that the vehicle is parked on a level surface.
Remove the fill plug from the axle.
The oil level must be even with the bottom of the fill plug hole.

item.para: If oil flows from the hole when the plug is loosened: The oil level is high. Let the oil drain to the correct level.
If the oil level is below the bottom of the fill plug hole: Add the specified oil.

step1.para: Install and tighten the fill plug to 35-50 lbf-ft (48-67 Nm).
Verify that the vehicle is parked on a level surface. Put a large container under the axle.
Remove the drain plug from the bottom of the axle. Drain and discard the oil properly.
Clean, install and tighten the drain plug to 35-50 lbf-ft (48-67 Nm).
Remove the fill plug from the axle.
Fill the axle to the bottom of the fill plug hole with the specified oil. Allow enough time for oil to circulate through the axle assembly.
Install and tighten the fill plug to 35-50 lbf-ft (48-67 Nm).
